thread.title: Donald Trump says the media missed nearly 80 global terror attacks. We didn’t
thread.title_full: Donald Trump says the media missed nearly 80 global terror attacks. We didn’t

author: Toronto Star staff
title: Donald Trump says the media missed nearly 80 global terror attacks. We didn’t
text: World Donald Trump says the media missed nearly 80 global terror attacks. We didn’t Almost all of 78 events the White House said have been under-reported by the media were reported by the Star or by major international media. ▶ Speaking to a military crowd at MacDill Air Force Base in Florida, President Donald Trump said America is determined to defeat terrorists and he said our country needs to make sure that people who want to destroy us aren't allowed in. (The Associated Press ) By Toronto Star staff Tues., Feb. 7, 2017 WASHINGTON—U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said that terrorist acts in Europe are going unreported. “All over Europe it’s happening,” he said. “It’s gotten to a point where it’s not even being reported. And in many cases the very, very dishonest press doesn’t want to report it. They have their reasons, and you understand that.” That claim is not supported by the facts. The White House later released a list of 78 worldwide attacks it described as “executed or inspired by” Daesh, also known as ISIS and ISIL, that it said did not get sufficient media attention. The following is that entire, unedited list released by the White House , complete with the misspellings and errors of the original. Almost all of the stories in this list were reported by the Star or by major international media. We indicate where: Article Continued Below NUMBER OF ATTACKS: 78 On Dec. 20, 2016, Tunisian national Anis Amri drove a truck into a crowded Christmas market in Berlin, killing 12 and wounding 48. The attack was widely reported by the media over the holidays. ( TOBIAS SCHWARZ / AFP/Getty Images ) MELBOURNE, AUSTRALIA September, 2014 TARGET: Two police officers wounded in knife attack ATTACKER: Abdul Numan Haider Organizations such as BBC and the Guardian covered this story. TIZI OUZOU, ALGERIA September, 2014 TARGET: One French citizen beheaded ATTACKER: Jund al-Khilafah in Algeria Organizations such as the Toronto Star and the Boston Globe covered this. QUEBEC, CANADA October, 2014 TARGET: One soldier killed and one wounded in vehicle attack ATTACKER: Martin Couture-Rouleau Canadian organizations such as the Star and the Globe and Mail covered this story. OTTAWA, CANADA October, 2014 Police search the bike path behind Parliament Hill following the shooting in Ottawa on Oct. 22, 2014. ( PATRICK DOYLE ) TARGET: One soldier killed at war memorial; two wounded in shootings at Parliament building ATTACKER: Michael Zehaf-Bibeau Canadian organizations such as the Star and the National Post covered this story. NEW YORK CITY, NY, U.S. October, 2014 TARGET: Two police officers wounded in knife attack ATTACKER: U.S. person Although vague, this might be referring to an event where Zale H. Thompson attacked several police officers in Queens. It was reported by the New York Times . RIYADH, SAUDI ARABIA November, 2014 TARGET: One Danish citizen wounded in shooting ATTACKERS: Three Saudi Arabia-based ISIL members This was covered by organizations such as the Wall Street Journal and Reuters . ABU DHABI, UAE December 2014 TARGET: One American killed in knife attack ATTACKER: Dalal al-Hashimi International organizations such as ABC News and CBS News covered this story. SYDNEY, AUSTRALIA December, 2014 TARGET: Two Australians killed in hostage taking and shooting ATTACKER: Man Haron Monis This was covered by Canadian organizations such as the Star and CBC . TOURS, FRANCE December, 2014 TARGET: Three police officers wounded in knife attack ATTACKER: Bertrand Nzohabonayo TARGET: One police officer and four hostages killed in shooting at a kosher supermarket ATTACKER: Amedy Coulibaly Organizations such as the Star and the Guardian covered this story. TRIPOLI, LIBYA January, 2015 TARGET: Ten killed, including one U.S. citizen, and five wounded in bombing and shooting at a hotel frequented by westerners ATTACKERS: As many as five ISIL-Libyan members Organizations such as the Star and BBC covered this story. RIYADH, SAUDI ARABIA January, 2015 TARGET: Two U.S. citizens wounded in shooting ATTACKER: Saudi Arabia-based ISIL supporter This could be referring to an event on February 1, 2015 where Vinnell Arabia says two of its staff were targeted in eastern al-Ahsa; or a killing in October 2014 where an American was fatally wounded in Riyadh. NICE, FRANCE February, 2015 Eighty-four people were killed after a truck plowed through Bastille Day revellers in the French resort city of Nice on July 14, 2016. ( Sasha Goldsmith ) TARGET: Two French soldiers wounded in knife attack outside a Jewish community center ATTACKER: Moussa Coulibaly International organizations such as the Guardian and BBC covered this story. COPENHAGEN, DENMARK February, 2015 TARGET: One civilian killed in shooting at a free-speech rally and one security guard killed outside the city's main synagogue ATTACKER: Omar Abdel Hamid el-Hussein The Star , CNN and ABC News were among organizations that covered this. TUNIS, TUNISIA March, 2015 TARGET: 21 tourists killed, including 16 westerners, and 55 wounded in shooting at the Bardo Museum ATTACKERS: Two ISIL-aligned extremists This was covered by organizations such as the Star , the Globe and Mail and Fox News . KARACHI, PAKISTAN April, 2015 TARGET: One U.S. citizen wounded in knife attack ATTACKERS: Pakistan-based ISIL supporters No reports could be found on this incident. However, international organizations such as the Guardian article says an American woman was shot and wounded in Pakistan in April 2015. PARIS, FRANCE April, 2015 TARGET: Catholic churches targeted; one civilian killed in shooting, possibly during an attempted carjacking ATTACKER: Sid Ahmed Ghlam Organizations such as the Star , Vice News , BBC and CNN covered this story. ZVORNIK, BOSNIA April, 2015 TARGET: One police officer killed and two wounded in shooting ATTACKER: Nerdin Ibric The Daily Mail covered this. GARLAND, TX, U.S. May, 2015 TARGET: One security guard wounded in shooting at the Prophet Muhammad cartoon event ATTACKERS: Two U.S. persons Organizations such as the Star , CBC and the Washington Post covered this story. BOSTON, MA, U.S. June, 2015 TARGET: No casualties; one police officer attacked with knife ATTACKER: U.S. person This could be referring to Usaama Rahim who was shot by officers. The Guardian article says Rahim threatened police officers with a knife. EL GORA (AL JURAH), EGYPT June, 2015 TARGET: No casualties; camp used by Multinational Force and Observers (MFO) troops attacked in shooting and bombing attack ATTACKERS: Unknown number of ISIL-Sinai members News reports could not be found on this incident. LUXOR, EGYPT June, 2015 TARGET: One police officer killed by suicide bomb near the Temple of Karnak ATTACKER: Unidentified This could be referring to an attack where a suicide bomber blew himself up near the ancient Egyptian temple of Karnak in Luxor. Four people, including two policemen, were wounded in the exchange between officers and two suspected Islamic militants. This could also be referring to an attack near the Giza pyramids where two police officers were killed. SOUSSE, TUNISIA June, 2015 TARGET: 38 killed and 39 wounded in shooting at a beach frequented by westerners ATTACKERS: Seifeddine Rezgui and another unidentified attacker Organizations such as the Star , the National Post , BBC and CNN covered this story. LYON, FRANCE June, 2015 TARGET: One civilian killed in beheading and explosion at a chemical plant ATTACKER: Yasin Salhi TARGET: One killed and nine wounded in VBIED attack at Italian Consulate ATTACKER: Unidentified ISIL operatives International organizations such as NBC News and the New York Times covered this story. CAIRO, EGYPT July, 2015 TARGET: One Croatian national kidnapped; beheaded on August 12 at an unknown location ATTACKER: Unidentified ISIL-Sinai operative Organizations such as the Star , BBC and CNN covered this story. PARIS, FRANCE August, 2015 TARGET: Two civilians and one U.S. soldier wounded with firearms and knife on a passenger train ATTACKER: Ayoub el-Khazzani EL GORA, EGYPT September, 2015 TARGET: Four U.S. and two MFO troops wounded in IED attack ATTACKER: Unidentified This was covered in the Washington Post and the Daily Beast . DHAKA, BANGLADESH September, 2015 TARGET: One Italian civilian killed in shooting ATTACKER: Unidentified This could refer to the killing of an Italian aid worker in Bangladesh. It was covered by Time , the Wall Street Journal and Al Jazeera . COPENHAGEN, DENMARK September, 2015 TARGET: One police officer wounded in knife attack ATTAKER: Palestinian national Although not widely reported, the Telegraph covered this story. EL GORA, EGYPT October, 2015 TARGET: No casualties; airfield used by MFO attacked with rockets ATTAKER: Unidentified ISIL-Sinai operatives News reports could not be found on this incident. PARRAMATTA, AUSTRALIA October, 2015 TARGET: One police officer killed in shooting ATTAKER: Farhad Jabar Organizations such as the Guardian and the New York Times covered this. RANGPUR, BANGLADESH October, 2015 TARGET: One Japanese civilian killed in shooting ATTAKER: Unidentified Organizations such as the Star , Reuters and the Washington Post covered this story. HASANAH, EGYPT October, 2015 TARGET: 224 killed in downing of a Russian airliner ATTAKER: Unidentified ISIL-Sinai operatives This was covered by media worldwide. MERCED, CA, U.S. November, 2015 TARGET: Four wounded in knife attack on a college campus ATTAKER: U.S. person Organizations such as the Los Angeles Times and CNN covered this. PARIS, FRANCE November, 2015 A woman walks by the Bataclan Theatre, one of the sites of the Paris attacks in November 2015. Donald Trump's administration included the attack on its list of terror acts they say were "underreported" by the media. ( PATRICK KOVARIK ) TARGET: At least 129 killed and approximately 400 wounded in series of shootings and IED attacks ATTAKERS: Brahim Abdelslam, Saleh Abdeslam, Ismail Mostefai, Bilal Hadfi, Samy Amimour, Chakib Ahrouh, Foued Mohamed Aggad, and Abdelhamid Abaaoud This was widely covered by media around the world. DINAJPUR, BANGLADESH November, 2015 TARGET: One Italian citizen wounded in shooting ATTAKER: Unidentified This was covered by organizations such as BBC and Reuters . RAJLOVAC, BOSNIA December, 2015 TARGET: Two Bosnian soldiers killed in shooting ATTAKER: Enes Omeragic This was covered by Reuters . SAN BERNADINO, CA, U.S. December, 2015 A SWAT vehicle carries police officers near the scene of the shooting in San Bernardino, Calif., on Dec. 2, 2015. Fourteen people were killed in the attack. ( Micah Escamilla ) TARGET: 14 killed and 21 wounded in coordinated firearms attack ATTAKERS: Two U.S. persons This was covered by organizations such as the Star , CNN and BBC . LONDON, ENGLAND, UK December, 2015 TARGET: Three wounded in knife attack at an underground rail station ATTAKER: Muhyadin Mire Organizations such as BBC and CNN covered this. DERBENT, RUSSIA December, 2015 TARGET: One killed and 11 wounded in shooting at UN World Heritage site ATTAKER: Unidentified ISIL-Caucasus operative This was covered by BBC . CAIRO, EGYPT January, 2016 TARGET: Two wounded in drive-by shooting outside a hotel frequented by tourists ATTAKERS: Unidentified ISIL operatives This could be referring to a drive-by shooting outside a Cairo hotel, but no casualties were reported. A police officer and soldier were shot dead near Cairo a couple days later. PARIS, FRANCE January, 2016 TARGET: No casualties; attacker killed after attempted knife attack on Paris police station ATTAKER: Tarek Belgacem Organizations such as the Independent and the Guardian covered this. PHILADELPHIA, PENNSYLVANIA January, 2016 TARGET: One police officer wounded in shooting ATTAKER: U.S. person Organizations such as the Star , BBC and the Guardian covered this. HURGHADA, EGYPT January, 2016 TARGET: One German and one Danish national wounded in knife attack at a tourist resort ATTAKER: Unidentified This was covered by the Star , the Telegraph and the Guardian . MARSEILLES, FRANCE January, 2016 TARGET: One Jewish teacher wounded in machete attack ATTAKER: 15 year-old Ethnic Kurd from Turkey TARGET: 12 German tourists killed and 15 wounded in suicide bombing ATTAKER: Nabil Fadli This has been covered by organizations such as the Star , the Wall Street Journal and Fox News . JAKARTA, INDONESIA January, 2016 TARGET: Four civilians killed and more than 20 wounded in coordinated bombing and firearms attacks near a police station and a Starbucks ATTAKERS: Dian Joni Kurnaiadi, Muhammad Ali, Arif Sunakim, and Ahmad Muhazan bin Saron COLUMBUS, OH, U.S. February, 2016 TARGET: Four civilians wounded in machete attack at a restaurant ATTAKER: U.S. person Organizations such as CBS News , CNN and the Washington Post covered this. HANOVER, GERMANY February, 2016 TARGET: One police officer wounded in knife attack ATTAKER: Safia Schmitter Organizations such as BBC and the Independent covered this. ISTANBUL, TURKEY March, 2016 TARGET: Four killed and 36 wounded in suicide bombing in the tourist district ATTAKER: Mehmet Ozturk This was covered by the Star , BBC and Reuters . BRUSSELS, BELGIUM March, 2016 TARGET: At least 31 killed and 270 wounded in coordinated bombings at Zaventem Airport and on a subway train ATTAKERS: Khalid el-Bakraoui, Ibrahim el-Bakraoui, Najim Laachraoui, Mohammed Abrini, and Osama Krayem This was widely covered by the media . ESSEN, GERMANY April, 2016 TARGET: Three wounded in bombing at Sikh temple ATTAKERS: Three identified minors This story was covered by the BBC and American wire service The Associated Press . ORLANDO, FL, U.S. June, 2016 TARGET: 49 killed and 53 wounded in shooting at a nightclub ATTAKER: U.S. person The attack on the Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Fla., was extensively covered by the media, even during the months following the attack, with the latest story recently as Feb. 1, 2017 . MAGNANVILLE, FRANCE June, 2016 TARGET: One police officer and one civilian killed in knife attack ATTAKER: Larossi Abballa This attack was reported by the Star (via The Associated Press), as well as other outlets such as BBC and the New York Times . KABUL, AFGHANISTAN June, 2016 TARGET: 14 killed in suicide attack on a bus carrying Canadian Embassy guards ATTAKER: ISIL-Khorasan operative In Canada, the suicide attack in Kabul was reported by the Star and The Canadian Press , as well as in international outlets such as The Guardian and Al Jazeera . ISTANBUL, TURKEY June, 2016 Damaged glass is shown at Ataturk International Airport in Istanbul, Turkey, in June 2016. Forty-five people were killed and approximately 240 were wounded in the terror attack. ( OZAN KOSE ) TARGET: 45 killed and approximately 240 wounded at Ataturk International Airport ATTACKERS: Rakhim Bulgarov, Vadim Osmanov, and an unidentified ISIL operative This event was widely reported by the media. DHAKA, BANGLADESH July, 2016 TARGET: 22 killed, including one American and 50 wounded after hours-long siege using machetes and firearms at holy Artisan Bakery ATTACKERS: Nibras Islam, Rohan Imtiaz, Meer Saameh Mubasheer, Khairul Islam Paye, and Shafiqul Islam Uzzal This story was covered extensively by The Star and other international outlets. A University of Toronto student was held as a suspect in the attacks before a Bangladesh court cleared him of all allegations. NICE, FRANCE July, 2016 TARGET: 84 civilians killed and 308 wounded by an individual who drove a truck into a crowd ATTACKER: Mohamed Bouhlel This story dominated headlines around the world in the hours and days after the attack. Outlets included BBC News , The Guardian , CNN , the Wall Street Journal , GQ and The Star . WURZBURG, GERMANY July, 2016 TARGET: Four civilians wounded in axe attack on a train ATTACKER: Riaz Khan Ahmadzai BBC News and CNN covered this story, among many other outlets. ANSBACH, GERMANY July, 2016 TARGET: At least 15 wounded in suicide bombing at a music festival ATTACKER: Mohammad Daleel The Guardian and The Star are among the outlets that covered this story. NORMANDY, FRANCE July, 2016 TARGET: One priest killed in knife attack ATTACKERS: Adel Kermiche and Abdel Malik Nabil Petitjean This story dominated international headlines, with outlets such as The Guardian and The Star reporting the story. CHALEROI [sic], BELGIUM August, 2016 TARGET: Two police officers wounded in machete attack ATTACKER: Khaled Babouri The name of the city is Charleroi. The Guardian and the Wall Street Journal are among the many outlets that covered this story. QUEENSLAND, AUSTRALIA, August, 2016 TARGET: Two killed and one wounded in knife attack at a hostel frequented by Westerners ATTACKER: Smail Ayad This attack, in which an individual stabbed several people at a hostel, was covered by BBC News and The Guardian . COPENHAGEN, DENMAKR [sic] September, 2016 TARGET: Two police officers and a civilian wounded in shooting ATTACKER: Mesa Hodzic Denmark is misspelled in the original White House list. This attack was covered widely, including by The Independent . PARIS, FRANCE September, 2016 TARGET: One police officer wounded in raid after VBIED failed to detonate at Notre Dame Cathedral ATTACKERS: Sarah Hervouet, Ines Madani, and Amel Sakaou This was allegedly an attempted attack involving several gas cylinders discovered in a vehicle — the acronym VBIED refers to a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device. The story covered by outlets like CNN , the Washington Post , and The Guardian . SYDNEY, AUSTRALIA September, 2016 TARGET: One civilian wounded in knife attack ATTACKER: Ihsas Khan A 22-year-old stabbed one person and attempted to attack a police officer in this attack, which was covered by CNN and ABC News . CLOUD [sic], MN, U.S. September, 2016 TARGET: 10 wounded in knife attack in a mall ATTACKER: Dahir Ahmed Adan The name of the Minnesota town is St. Cloud. The story was covered by CNN and The Star . NEW YORK, NY; SEASIDE PARK AND ELIZABETH, NJ, U.S. September, 2016 TARGET: 31 wounded in bombing in New York City; several explosive devices found in New York and New Jersey; one exploded without casualty at race in New Jersey; one police officer wounded in shootout ATTACKER: Ahmad Khan Rahami Media outlets around the world reported this story, including The Star , The Guardian and BBC News . BRUSSELS, BELGIUM October, 2016 TARGET: Two police officers wounded in stabbing ATTACKER: Belgian national BBC News and CBC covered this story. KUWAIT CITY, KUWAIT TARGET: No casualties; vehicle carrying three U.S. soldiers hit by a truck ATTACKER: Ibrahim Sulayman The Star published this story. MALMO, SWEDEN October, 2016 TARGET: No casualties; mosque and community center attacked with Molotov cocktail ATTACKER: Syrian national Coverage of the subsequent arrest of the suspect was published by Fox News . HAMBURG, GERMANY October, 2016 TARGET: One killed in knife attack ATTACKER: Unknown This story that was covered by the Telegraph , among others. MANILA, PHILIPPINES November, 2016 TARGET: No casualties; failed IED attempt near U.S. Embassy ATTACKERS: Philippine nationals aligned with the Maute group Police found and safely neutralized an IED that had been placed outside the U.S. Embassy in Manila at the end of November. Time.com and Reuters both covered the story. COLUMBUS, OH, U.S. November, 2016 TARGET: 14 wounded by individuals who drove a vehicle into a group of pedestrians and attacked them with a knife ATTACKER: U.S. person Numerous media outlets, including The Star and USA Today ran the story. N'DJAMENA, CHAD November, 2016 TARGET: No casualties; attacker arrested after opening fire at entrance of U.S. Embassy ATTACKER: Chadian national Although not widely reported, the French-language daily L’Orient Le Jour reported the story, as did Africa News . KARAK, JORDAN December, 2016 TARGET: 10 killed and 28 wounded in shooting at a tourist site ATTACKERS: Several gunmen This shooting, which killed 10 people, including a retired Canadian teacher, was covered in The Star and the Washington Post . BERLIN, GERMANY December, 2016 TARGET: 12 killed and 48 wounded by individual who drove truck into a crowded market ATTACKER: Anis Amri Coverage of this widely-reported attack appeared in such publication as The Guardian , The Star , and the CBC . With files from the Associated Press Delivered daily The Morning Headlines Newsletter Subscribe The Toronto Star and thestar.com, each property of Toronto Star Newspapers Limited, One Yonge Street, 4th Floor, Toronto, ON, M5E 1E6.
